head.title: On Stage, Not on the Web

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Music, Theater and Dance

hedline.hl1: On Stage, Not on the Web

abstract.p: Singer-songwriter Loudon Wainwright 3rd will perform in concert at Scottish Rite Auditorium in Collingswood, NJ; photo (S)

block.p: Loudon Wainwright III has two main claims to fame: the satiric 1973 hit ''Dead Skunk'' and the topical songs about figures like Tonya Harding (''Tonya's Twirls'') and Jesse Helms (''Jesse Don't Like It'') that he has written for National Public Radio.

But there is more to the singer-songwriter than his smart-aleck side, especially lately, as he has turned out wistful, lyrical songs about fatherhood and the loss of his parents. One new song, ''Last Man on Earth,'' which Mr. Wainwright played a few months ago on ''Late Night With Conan O'Brien,'' has become an emerging anthem for the lost-in-cyberspace set. Midway through the song, when Mr. Wainwright sings, ''Everybody's got a Web site but that's all Greek to me/ I don't own a computer and I hate that letter E,'' concert audiences often burst into applause.

Loudon Wainwright III has two main claims to fame: the satiric 1973 hit ''Dead Skunk'' and the topical songs about figures like Tonya Harding (''Tonya's Twirls'') and Jesse Helms (''Jesse Don't Like It'') that he has written for National Public Radio.

But there is more to the singer-songwriter than his smart-aleck side, especially lately, as he has turned out wistful, lyrical songs about fatherhood and the loss of his parents. One new song, ''Last Man on Earth,'' which Mr. Wainwright played a few months ago on ''Late Night With Conan O'Brien,'' has become an emerging anthem for the lost-in-cyberspace set. Midway through the song, when Mr. Wainwright sings, ''Everybody's got a Web site but that's all Greek to me/ I don't own a computer and I hate that letter E,'' concert audiences often burst into applause.
Mr. Wainwright appears with Chris Smither on Friday at 8 p.m. at the Scottish Rite Auditorium in Collingswood.
